summary: My and my dad were talking about Hawkeye being in the next Avengers movie and he turns around and goes "You know his wife and at...
body:
My and my dad were talking about Hawkeye being in the next Avengers movie and he turns around and goes “You know his wife and at least ONE of his kids disappeared. He was probably just sitting there on his farm relaxing when they disappeared and is like WHAT HAVE YOU GUYS DONE.


That’s how he came out of retirement again.”

title: Black Widow: Sexual Espionage
body:
Natasha Romanoff is gay. And no one in the Marvel Cinematic Lesbian Universe is safe…

An Avenger’s Consequences

Creeping through the solitary darkness, the Black Widow gradually emerged from the shadows. Slipping through the open courtyard, the redhead vaulted over a high fence before dropping down into a sea…

title: ’Art Exhibit’ - Avengers x Fem!Mutant!Reader One-Shot
body:
Playlist:

  • Art Exhibit by Young the Giant
  • Terrence Loves You by Lana del Rey
  • Outro by M83

  The museum was new, but the murders weren’t as recent. That’s why it had taken S.H.I.E.L.D. so long to trace the source. The Russian and the Super Soldier stood in a corner of the showroom, pretending to be engrossed in analyzing a piece by some Impressionist artist or another. In an escaped second, the room was deafeningly silent, and the sound of retreating footsteps brought the Soldier and the Russian around. The Spy hurried after them with a determined step.

  “I guess we’ll be going then,” Steve sighed and followed after his friend, ready for a fight. The two Avengers looked around the room, observing the guests.

  “Steve, not all of them are wearing the black bands around their wrists. See?” Natasha whispered into his ear, pointing at the group of people standing in front of them.

  “Interesting. Also, why would art enthusiasts would be standing in a room full of amazing sculptures but pay no attention to them and stare at the staircase instead?”

  “Yeah… you’re right. And with such anticipation too?” The Spy furrowed her brow and moved her hand to the close of the slit on her skirt, letting it rest over the gun strapped to her thigh.

  “I guess we’ll wait and see.”

  The chamber musicians put a halt to their playing, and the lights dimmed significantly, forcing their eyes to rely on the vague illumination that the bluish lights in the floor provided. The silence made them anxious. The hammering heartbeats of the people around them seem to echo against the walls. Much to their dismay, the sound of clicking heels against the marble floor accompanied each thump seamlessly. It was a rather morbid experience.

  Steve was unsure if he should breath and risk disturbing the waters. He was sure wicked creatures waited beneath its surface. The steps began to sound louder and stopped. A woman of dubious nature stood at the top of the stairs, a glass of wine hung idly from her right hand. She was clothed in ivory silk, adorned with black pearls, and cloaked in sin, and the sight of her made the Soldier gasp for air. The ever-stoic Spy beside him had retrieved her hand from its position over her weapon, not wanting to look away from the alluring creature before her.

  “Welcome, all,” her voice rang clear in a sultry purr, “To the Gallery.” Her piercing eyes scanned the room and her lips curled in a tantalizing grin. Her victims clapped, endearingly oblivious of having become victims as soon as they had entered through the crystal-encrusted doors. “It is an indescribable pleasure to see you all here tonight. I sure hope you brought your monsters along.” Some guests around them laughed as if her words had been a delightful joke; other guests admired the woman with glazed eyes. “Now, I know that the night is short, and you have all been awfully patient. To our VIP guests, thank you for your undying support. The Gallery wouldn’t have happened without you. A round of applause for our VIP guests, please,” the woman clapped her hands in initiative and the rest of the crowd soon joined her.

  “Look at that woman over there. She looks ridiculously smug,” the Russian pointed out, breaking Steve from his trance.

  “And she’s wearing a black band.”

  “Stay sharp, Rogers. That woman might just be who we’re looking for.”

  No, she isn’t! His heart insisted, but his mind was quick to silence it after the Spy’s remark.

  “With no further do, enjoy the Exhibit.”

  As if by command, works of art incarnate stepped off the walls and closed in around the crowd, sauntering and smirking as if all the nights in history were compressed into their cores. Natasha pulled Steve back by the elbow, bumping against two tall men. Her hand returned to her thigh, a decision away from shooting. The two Avengers noticed that the “exhibits” clung to the VIP guests, caressing and whispering and taunting before whisking them away behind curtains. The band began to play a lively jazz tune, and the Spy pulled the Soldier to the middle of the floor, away from the bouncers. Steve quickly fell into step with Natasha, leaning his face against her hand as she stroked his cheek “lovingly”.

  “Kiss me,” she whispered for the watching crowd, using the opportunity to speak into the mic hidden in the collar of his shirt, “Stark, stay alert. This is about to get ugly.”

  “That’s alright. Point Break is about to crash in through the windows right about…now,” Tony Stark replied into her earpiece, “Reindeer Games tried to stop him but hey, Asgardians.” Steve’s slight nod made her understand that he was told as well. The plan was set into motion. The sound of crashing glass sent the crowd into a frenzy as a lightning bolt struck the marble floor. The bewilderment was fed when a blond man stood in the cracked stone and a dark-haired man emerged from seemingly nowhere.

  “Honestly, Thor, this was exactly what we were told to not do,” the raven-haired god snapped, daggers at the ready.

  “Hush, brother, there are Brother Rogers and Lady Romanoff! Has the fight begun?” The Thunderer asked with a wave at his teammates.

  “Now it has,” Natasha replied, guns in both hands, “We have to find her. Loki, come with me. Steve and Thor, you’re both preoccupied already.” She nodded at the approaching bouncers. The Russian spoke into her mic, “Stark, scan the building and find the victims.”

  “Yes, ma’am,” the Tycoon replied, and Natasha could swear she could hear Rio by Duran Duran playing faintly in the background, “Buck-Buck is headed your way now.”

  “Spotted him,” the Spy signaled at the White Wolf and the Trickster to follow her, and the trio made their way down the halls in search of their villain. 

———————————————————————————————————–

 Your hands trembled, making you drop the bullets all across the tiled floor. You cursed and threw the gun to the side; it was useless to you by now. Your personal mission had been accomplished that night; you had avenged your father. You were sure that woman had paid her dues in the hands of your ‘exhibits’. The rest could go to hell.

  “Hands in the air where I can see them,” you heard a female voice command. You decided to oblige with a smirk. Slowly, you turned around and lifted your hands to the air.

  “Oh, hello,” you crooned, “I saw you earlier at the gathering. I must say, you are quite beautiful. You look stunning in that dress, Black Widow.”

  “Enough sweet talk, Renderer,” the Widow turned to the deity beside her. You recognized him from the Stuttgart and New York incidents. You also noticed the power-repressing cuffs in his hands, the ones used on mutants. A familiar stinging sensation on your eyes urged you to strengthen your act. You lowered your hands and outstretched them before you. You didn’t want to kill them… but give them a fight? Why not? You visualized her cardiovascular system, the intricate paths of veins and arteries and capillaries. It was beautiful. You curled your fingers in, slowing the flow of her bloodstream. The fear in her eyes turned to determination, so you pulled in a bit more. Once you were sure she wouldn’t be able defend herself, you kicked the Russian in the gut, making her groan in the heightened sense of pain that the effects of your power provided.

  You ran, leaving the Widow crumbled in the floor; her previous state of health would take some time to return, time you were planning to use at your advantage. Down the hall, you spotted the Winter Soldier and the God of Mischief himself running towards you. You were quick to slow the human’s system, but the god? There was nothing, no life. The living scared you more than the unliving, so you ignored the illusion, elbowed the human in the back and continued your escape. You reached the staircase in which you had welcomed your guests before and saw the rest of the Avengers. A satisfied smile rose to your lips as you heard the sounds of slowing hearts fill the air. You had won.

  Or so you thought.

  Iron Man landed in front of you, startling you and breaking your concentration.

  “The man with no heart.”

  “Shouldn’t you be at home asleep? Tonight’s a school night, and I don’t know much about kids, but I know that they should go to sleep at nine o’clock every night,” the Tycoon spoke from inside his suit.

  Your hands were suddenly pulled to the front of your body, and a pair of power-repressing handcuffs encircled your wrists. You recognized the dark-haired man immediately, and you grinned sheepishly as you noticed the two Avengers flanking him.

  “Ohhh…God of Mischief, what a pleasure it is to meet you. I ran into one of your illusions earlier, almost fooled me,” you purred, “If I promise to be good, would you show me some tricks?”

  “Perhaps,” Loki replied with no evidence of mirth. You knew he could see right through you. The sight of the handcuffs brought you painful memories, and he knew it. Immediately, you felt the numbing sensation of your powers sinking into the marrow of your bones.

  “Winter Soldier,” you cooed, amused by the trio before you, “Might I say that you’re positively legendary?”

  “White Wolf.”

  “Ah, reformed, aren’t we? How sweet.”

  The Russian glared at you to remain silent, obviously displeased with your manhandling her.

  “You’re coming with us, Renderer,” Natasha grabbed you by the cuffs and led you out of your ‘beloved’ gallery. You wished it would burn.

———————————————————————————————————–

One Week Later

  “Y/N?”

  You looked up from your drawing to see Steve Rogers standing at your doorway. He had a plate in his hands, and by what you could smell, he carried pizza.

  “I figured you might be hungry, so I brought you some pizza,” Steve stepped into your room cautiously, as if to not incite you to pounce. You had no desire to harm him, and even if you did, the cuffs Tony had fashioned for you wouldn’t allow you to hurt him. These new cuffs had no link in between, which allowed you to move your hands freely, but they still repressed your abilities. You remained silent as you watched him place the plate on the desk from your place on the bed.

  “Well… if you need anything, don’t hesitate to ask.”

  You wanted to ask when they would set you free. You wanted to ask if S.H.I.E.L.D. would be testing you. You hated needles. You wanted to ask if S.H.I.E.L.D. would prod you with needles. But all you could do was glare at the back of his head as he walked away. Your pride hardened your spine.

Three Weeks Later

  “You need to learn to defend yourself. Don’t get me wrong, those powers of yours are pretty damn impressive. However, your self-defense skills are pitiful,” Tony stated bluntly, offering you some blueberries, “Nat’s gonna teach you martial arts. Loki offered to teach you how to wield daggers. Buck’s gonna teach you how to fire a gun…”

  “I pass.”

  “Sorry, kid. I wasn’t asking you if you were up to it.”

  “You can’t make me, Stark.”

  “Those cute bracelets tell me otherwise.”

  The man was infuriating… you kinda liked him.

Three Weeks Later

  You were sitting on a stool, cradling your bandaged ankle. Despite your efforts of staying away, you had agreed to taking the lessons. Nick Fury had even recommended the team took you out for a mission, as long as it was a simple one and your powers remained repressed for the time being. Grace wasn’t one of your most notable traits. While trying to aim a kick too high for your extensions, you twisted your ankle. Of course, you refused to admit this. You had found a unused bandage on your first-aid kit and treated to your injured ankle yourself.

  The team was gathered in the living room celebrating their success. You wanted to join them so badly, but your pride forced you to remain in your seat. You could sense their laughter rushing through their veins. It was warm and inviting, almost made you laugh along. However, you ignored them and proceeded to nibble on a piece of Wonder bread. The smell of Chinese food was also awfully appetizing and made your snack seem ridiculous. The laughter felt a bit more emphasized now. That meant somebody was approaching you. Effectively, you looked to your left to meet the smiling eyes of Bruce Banner.

  “Hey, you did good out there today.”

  You gave the gentle man a small, almost imperceptible, grin. You had a soft spot for the Doctor. He was docile and genuine, and the Other Guy was also high on your list of favorite people.

  “Thanks.”

  “No problem,” Banner seemed to hesitate for a moment, “Won’t you join us? There’s enough food to go around, and to be honest with you, we’re all curious about you, Y/N.”

  “Curious? About me?” Well, that’s definitely new.

  Bruce nodded and offered you a smile, showing you were indeed welcome.

  “Alright.” Carefully, you got off the stool and followed him into the living room. You surveyed the room. Everybody was so casual and relaxed, like normal people.

  “Lady Y/N! You have decided to join us! Great! Have you tried that chicken lathered in the odd red sauce? It is my favorite.” You did your best to keep yourself from smiling. Thor was the very definition of sunshine.

  “Actually, I haven’t tried it. I’ll try it now.”

  Bucky gave you a small grin and scooted to the side, giving you a spot on the carpet beside him. You looked around for any signs of discomfort, but having found just acceptance and friendliness, you sat beside the White Wolf and served yourself some sweet and sour chicken and some fried rice. Soon, you were swept by light friendly chatter, and you could feel yourself thawing for them, eager to let this odd family into your life. You wanted to be part of that family before you desperately.

One Month Later

  It all happened so fast.

  You just knew you couldn’t let Steve get shot.

  No, not him.

  You pressed your hand to your ribs in astonishment. A bullet had entered your body. You had felt it ricochet inside you. But the team needed your help, so you focused all your energy on crushing airways and stopping hearts from pumping blood regardless of your own failing system.

  The Avengers had won, as per usual, but Clint had received the ugliest blow. You averted your gaze from his protruding femur and concentrated on holding unto your body. The after-battle banter started between Clint and Natasha, something about Budapest you couldn’t quite grasp. Then it moved on to Thor and Loki spewing embarrassing stories about each other. Soon you were being teased by Bucky, and even in your hazy state, you threw some remarks towards him, making him laugh in spite of his own injuries. However, Natasha seemed to pick up on your strained voice.

  “Y/N, are you injured?” Natasha asked, eyeing your leather jacket (which you had zipped closed some time along the fight to cover the bullet hole), not fully trusting your judgment when it came to injuries.

  “I’ll be fine. Don’t worry about me.”

  “You’re pale. Nat, she’s pale,” Clint grunted, tugging at Natasha’s sleeve.

  Loki removed your jacket in a ripple of green, and his eyes instantly fell on your ruined suit, “Lady Y/N…”

  You couldn’t hear the end of his sentence. 

———————————————————————————————————–

The annoying beeping of a machine brought you around. Your groggy eyes struggled to focus on the various tubes and machinery. The smell… a hospital… you hated hospitals. Your father was smothered to death in a hospital.

  A tall man in white sauntered into the room, “Ah, you’re awake! Excellent. My name’s Dr. Strange, and I’m here to inform you that a ragtag group of people in tight clothing have been waiting to hear from you for hours. They keep asking about you, and to be frank, they’ve been scaring my nurses. So, I’ll just let them in now.”

  In a blur, the Avengers rushed into your room and flocked your bed. Tony and Bruce were quick to interrogate the doctor. The Asgardians professed their displeasure about the thin white blankets and proceeded to remove their capes to cover you with them. Natasha pushed the wheelchair in which Clint was sitting on to your bedside and began to fill you in on everything that you had missed, including the fact that Tony had considered adopting you in order to get your information from the nurses, “He started to rant in the waiting room. I swear, he even cursed on the name of whoever it was that came up with the patient confidentiality law… I’ll show you the video later.”  

  Then came Steve Rogers, and the room fell silent. The doctor excused himself and closed the door after him to give you all some privacy.

  “You didn’t have to take that bullet, Y/N,” Steve carefully sat beside you, smoothing your hair back, “But you did, and I’m forever indebted to you. ‘Thank you’ will never suffice. You’re mighty brave, kid.”

  You looked around you, drinking in the bruised and scratched faces of your new family. Yes… family. Family never abandons, and they refused to abandon you. And they sat on uncomfortable chairs. And they scared nurses… all for you. Tears spilled from your eyes, and you let them; you felt safe and ready to step out from behind the cover of villainy. You didn’t need it anymore, and they knew it. The kiss Natasha pressed to your forehead was enough proof.

  “According to the Mr. Weird, you’re ready to go home, kid,” Tony chirped, clearly uncomfortable with the warm atmosphere.

  “Home?” Your voice was a mere whisper, but to you, it was the loudest word you had ever uttered.  

  “Home.”

  “That’s alright. The plan was set into motion. The sound of crashing glass sent the crowd into a frenzy as a lightning bolt struck the marble floor.   “Kiss me,” she whispered for the watching crowd, using the opportunity to speak into the mic hidden in the collar of his shirt, “Stark, stay alert. This is about to get ugly.”

  “That’s alright. Point Break is about to crash in through the windows right about…now,” Tony Stark replied into her earpiece, “Reindeer Games tried to stop him but hey, Asgardians.” Steve’s slight nod made her understand that he was told as well. The plan was set into motion. The sound of crashing glass sent the crowd into a frenzy as a lightning bolt struck the marble floor. The bewilderment was fed when a blond man stood in the cracked stone and a dark-haired man emerged from seemingly nowhere.

  “Honestly, Thor, this was exactly what we were told to not do,” the raven-haired god snapped, daggers at the ready.

  “Hush, brother, there are Brother Rogers and Lady Romanoff! Has the fight begun?” The Thunderer asked with a wave at his teammates.

  “Now it has,” Natasha replied, guns in both hands, “We have to find her. Loki, come with me. Steve and Thor, you’re both preoccupied already.” She nodded at the approaching bouncers. The Russian spoke into her mic, “Stark, scan the building and find the victims.”

  “Yes, ma’am,” the Tycoon replied, and Natasha could swear she could hear Rio by Duran Duran playing faintly in the background, “Buck-Buck is headed your way now.”

  “Spotted him,” the Spy signaled at the White Wolf and the Trickster to follow her, and the trio made their way down the halls in search of their villain. 

———————————————————————————————————–

 Your hands trembled, making you drop the bullets all across the tiled floor. You cursed and threw the gun to the side; it was useless to you by now. Your personal mission had been accomplished that night; you had avenged your father. You were sure that woman had paid her dues in the hands of your ‘exhibits’. The rest could go to hell.

  “Hands in the air where I can see them,” you heard a female voice command. You decided to oblige with a smirk. Slowly, you turned around and lifted your hands to the air.

  “Oh, hello,” you crooned, “I saw you earlier at the gathering. I must say, you are quite beautiful. You look stunning in that dress, Black Widow.”

  “Enough sweet talk, Renderer,” the Widow turned to the deity beside her. You recognized him from the Stuttgart and New York incidents. You also noticed the power-repressing cuffs in his hands, the ones used on mutants. A familiar stinging sensation on your eyes urged you to strengthen your act. You lowered your hands and outstretched them before you. You didn’t want to kill them… but give them a fight? Why not? You visualized her cardiovascular system, the intricate paths of veins and arteries and capillaries. It was beautiful. You curled your fingers in, slowing the flow of her bloodstream. The fear in her eyes turned to determination, so you pulled in a bit more. Once you were sure she wouldn’t be able defend herself, you kicked the Russian in the gut, making her groan in the heightened sense of pain that the effects of your power provided.

  You ran, leaving the Widow crumbled in the floor; her previous state of health would take some time to return, time you were planning to use at your advantage. Down the hall, you spotted the Winter Soldier and the God of Mischief himself running towards you. You were quick to slow the human’s system, but the god? There was nothing, no life. The living scared you more than the unliving, so you ignored the illusion, elbowed the human in the back and continued your escape. You reached the staircase in which you had welcomed your guests before and saw the rest of the Avengers. A satisfied smile rose to your lips as you heard the sounds of slowing hearts fill the air. You had won.

  Or so you thought.

  Iron Man landed in front of you, startling you and breaking your concentration.

  “The man with no heart.”

  “Shouldn’t you be at home asleep? Tonight’s a school night, and I don’t know much about kids, but I know that they should go to sleep at nine o’clock every night,” the Tycoon spoke from inside his suit.

  Your hands were suddenly pulled to the front of your body, and a pair of power-repressing handcuffs encircled your wrists. You recognized the dark-haired man immediately, and you grinned sheepishly as you noticed the two Avengers flanking him.

  “Ohhh…God of Mischief, what a pleasure it is to meet you. I ran into one of your illusions earlier, almost fooled me,” you purred, “If I promise to be good, would you show me some tricks?”

  “Perhaps,” Loki replied with no evidence of mirth. You knew he could see right through you. The sight of the handcuffs brought you painful memories, and he knew it. Immediately, you felt the numbing sensation of your powers sinking into the marrow of your bones.

  “Winter Soldier,” you cooed, amused by the trio before you, “Might I say that you’re positively legendary?”

  “White Wolf.”

  “Ah, reformed, aren’t we? How sweet.”

  The Russian glared at you to remain silent, obviously displeased with your manhandling her.

  “You’re coming with us, Renderer,” Natasha grabbed you by the cuffs and led you out of your ‘beloved’ gallery. You wished it would burn.

———————————————————————————————————–

One Week Later

  “Y/N?”

  You looked up from your drawing to see Steve Rogers standing at your doorway. He had a plate in his hands, and by what you could smell, he carried pizza.

  “I figured you might be hungry, so I brought you some pizza,” Steve stepped into your room cautiously, as if to not incite you to pounce. You had no desire to harm him, and even if you did, the cuffs Tony had fashioned for you wouldn’t allow you to hurt him. These new cuffs had no link in between, which allowed you to move your hands freely, but they still repressed your abilities. You remained silent as you watched him place the plate on the desk from your place on the bed.

  “Well… if you need anything, don’t hesitate to ask.”

  You wanted to ask when they would set you free. You wanted to ask if S.H.I.E.L.D. would be testing you. You hated needles. You wanted to ask if S.H.I.E.L.D. would prod you with needles. But all you could do was glare at the back of his head as he walked away. Your pride hardened your spine.

Three Weeks Later

  “You need to learn to defend yourself. Don’t get me wrong, those powers of yours are pretty damn impressive. However, your self-defense skills are pitiful,” Tony stated bluntly, offering you some blueberries, “Nat’s gonna teach you martial arts. Loki offered to teach you how to wield daggers. Buck’s gonna teach you how to fire a gun…”

  “I pass.”

  “Sorry, kid. I wasn’t asking you if you were up to it.”

  “You can’t make me, Stark.”

  “Those cute bracelets tell me otherwise.”

  The man was infuriating… you kinda liked him.

Three Weeks Later

  You were sitting on a stool, cradling your bandaged ankle. Despite your efforts of staying away, you had agreed to taking the lessons. Nick Fury had even recommended the team took you out for a mission, as long as it was a simple one and your powers remained repressed for the time being. Grace wasn’t one of your most notable traits. While trying to aim a kick too high for your extensions, you twisted your ankle. Of course, you refused to admit this. You had found a unused bandage on your first-aid kit and treated to your injured ankle yourself.

  The team was gathered in the living room celebrating their success. You wanted to join them so badly, but your pride forced you to remain in your seat. You could sense their laughter rushing through their veins. It was warm and inviting, almost made you laugh along. However, you ignored them and proceeded to nibble on a piece of Wonder bread. The smell of Chinese food was also awfully appetizing and made your snack seem ridiculous. The laughter felt a bit more emphasized now. That meant somebody was approaching you. Effectively, you looked to your left to meet the smiling eyes of Bruce Banner.

  “Hey, you did good out there today.”

  You gave the gentle man a small, almost imperceptible, grin. You had a soft spot for the Doctor. He was docile and genuine, and the Other Guy was also high on your list of favorite people.

  “Thanks.”

  “No problem,” Banner seemed to hesitate for a moment, “Won’t you join us? There’s enough food to go around, and to be honest with you, we’re all curious about you, Y/N.”

  “Curious? About me?” Well, that’s definitely new.

  Bruce nodded and offered you a smile, showing you were indeed welcome.

  “Alright.” Carefully, you got off the stool and followed him into the living room. You surveyed the room. Everybody was so casual and relaxed, like normal people.

  “Lady Y/N! You have decided to join us! Great! Have you tried that chicken lathered in the odd red sauce? It is my favorite.” You did your best to keep yourself from smiling. Thor was the very definition of sunshine.

  “Actually, I haven’t tried it. I’ll try it now.”

  Bucky gave you a small grin and scooted to the side, giving you a spot on the carpet beside him. You looked around for any signs of discomfort, but having found just acceptance and friendliness, you sat beside the White Wolf and served yourself some sweet and sour chicken and some fried rice. Soon, you were swept by light friendly chatter, and you could feel yourself thawing for them, eager to let this odd family into your life. You wanted to be part of that family before you desperately.

One Month Later

  It all happened so fast.

  You just knew you couldn’t let Steve get shot.

  No, not him.

  You pressed your hand to your ribs in astonishment. A bullet had entered your body. You had felt it ricochet inside you. But the team needed your help, so you focused all your energy on crushing airways and stopping hearts from pumping blood regardless of your own failing system.

  The Avengers had won, as per usual, but Clint had received the ugliest blow. You averted your gaze from his protruding femur and concentrated on holding unto your body. The after-battle banter started between Clint and Natasha, something about Budapest you couldn’t quite grasp. Then it moved on to Thor and Loki spewing embarrassing stories about each other. Soon you were being teased by Bucky, and even in your hazy state, you threw some remarks towards him, making him laugh in spite of his own injuries. However, Natasha seemed to pick up on your strained voice.

  “Y/N, are you injured?” Natasha asked, eyeing your leather jacket (which you had zipped closed some time along the fight to cover the bullet hole), not fully trusting your judgment when it came to injuries.

  “I’ll be fine. Don’t worry about me.”

  “You’re pale. Nat, she’s pale,” Clint grunted, tugging at Natasha’s sleeve.

  Loki removed your jacket in a ripple of green, and his eyes instantly fell on your ruined suit, “Lady Y/N…”

  You couldn’t hear the end of his sentence. 

———————————————————————————————————–

The annoying beeping of a machine brought you around. Your groggy eyes struggled to focus on the various tubes and machinery. The smell… a hospital… you hated hospitals. Your father was smothered to death in a hospital.

  A tall man in white sauntered into the room, “Ah, you’re awake! Excellent. My name’s Dr. Strange, and I’m here to inform you that a ragtag group of people in tight clothing have been waiting to hear from you for hours. They keep asking about you, and to be frank, they’ve been scaring my nurses. So, I’ll just let them in now.”

  In a blur, the Avengers rushed into your room and flocked your bed. Tony and Bruce were quick to interrogate the doctor. The Asgardians professed their displeasure about the thin white blankets and proceeded to remove their capes to cover you with them. Natasha pushed the wheelchair in which Clint was sitting on to your bedside and began to fill you in on everything that you had missed, including the fact that Tony had considered adopting you in order to get your information from the nurses, “He started to rant in the waiting room. I swear, he even cursed on the name of whoever it was that came up with the patient confidentiality law… I’ll show you the video later.”  

  Then came Steve Rogers, and the room fell silent. The doctor excused himself and closed the door after him to give you all some privacy.

  “You didn’t have to take that bullet, Y/N,” Steve carefully sat beside you, smoothing your hair back, “But you did, and I’m forever indebted to you. ‘Thank you’ will never suffice. You’re mighty brave, kid.”

  You looked around you, drinking in the bruised and scratched faces of your new family. Yes… family. Family never abandons, and they refused to abandon you. And they sat on uncomfortable chairs. And they scared nurses… all for you. Tears spilled from your eyes, and you let them; you felt safe and ready to step out from behind the cover of villainy. You didn’t need it anymore, and they knew it. The kiss Natasha pressed to your forehead was enough proof.

  “According to the Mr. Weird, you’re ready to go home, kid,” Tony chirped, clearly uncomfortable with the warm atmosphere.

  “Home?” Your voice was a mere whisper, but to you, it was the loudest word you had ever uttered.  

  “Home.”

  “Steve, not all of them are wearing the black bands around their wrists. See?” Natasha whispered into his ear, pointing at the group of people standing in front of them.

  “Interesting. Also, why would art enthusiasts would be standing in a room full of amazing sculptures but pay no attention to them and stare at the staircase instead?”

  “Yeah… you’re right. And with such anticipation too?” The Spy furrowed her brow and moved her hand to the close of the slit on her skirt, letting it rest over the gun strapped to her thigh.

  “I guess we’ll wait and see.”

The silence made them anxious. The hammering heartbeats of the people around them seem to echo against the walls. Much to their dismay, the sound of clicking heels against the marble floor accompanied each thump seamlessly. It was a rather morbid experience.

A woman of dubious nature stood at the top of the stairs, a glass of wine hung idly from her right hand. She was clothed in ivory silk, adorned with black pearls, and cloaked in sin, and the sight of her made the Soldier gasp for air. The ever-stoic Spy beside him had retrieved her hand from its position over her weapon, not wanting to look away from the alluring creature before her.

  “Welcome, all,” her voice rang clear in a sultry purr, “To the Gallery.” Her piercing eyes scanned the room and her lips curled in a tantalizing grin. Her victims clapped, endearingly oblivious of having become victims as soon as they had entered through the crystal-encrusted doors. “It is an indescribable pleasure to see you all here tonight. I sure hope you brought your monsters along.” Some guests around them laughed as if her words had been a delightful joke; other guests admired the woman with glazed eyes. “Now, I know that the night is short, and you have all been awfully patient. To our VIP guests, thank you for your undying support. The Gallery wouldn’t have happened without you. A round of applause for our VIP guests, please,” the woman clapped her hands in initiative and the rest of the crowd soon joined her.

  “Look at that woman over there. She looks ridiculously smug,” the Russian pointed out, breaking Steve from his trance.

  “And she’s wearing a black band.”

  No, she isn’t! His heart insisted, but his mind was quick to silence it after the Spy’s remark.
